values.name: GraalVM Native Support
values.description: Support for compiling Spring applications to native executables using the GraalVM native-image compiler.

values.name: GraphQL DGS Code Generation
values.description: Generate data types and type-safe APIs for querying GraphQL APIs by parsing schema files.

values.name: Spring Boot DevTools
values.description: Provides fast application restarts, LiveReload, and configurations for enhanced development experience.

values.name: Lombok
values.description: Java annotation library which helps to reduce boilerplate code.

values.name: Spring Configuration Processor
values.description: Generate metadata for developers to offer contextual help and "code completion" when working with custom configuration keys (ex.application.properties/.yml files).

values.name: Docker Compose Support
values.description: Provides docker compose support for enhanced development experience.

values.name: Spring Modulith
values.description: Support for building modular monolithic applications.

values.name: Spring Web
values.description: Build web, including RESTful, applications using Spring MVC. Uses Apache Tomcat as the default embedded container.

guide.title: Serving Web Content with Spring MVC

values.name: Spring Reactive Web
values.description: Build reactive web applications with Spring WebFlux and Netty.

guide.title: Building a Reactive RESTful Web Service

values.name: Spring for GraphQL
values.description: Build GraphQL applications with Spring for GraphQL and GraphQL Java.

values.name: Rest Repositories
values.description: Exposing Spring Data repositories over REST via Spring Data REST.

values.name: Spring Session
values.description: Provides an API and implementations for managing user session information.

values.name: Rest Repositories HAL Explorer
values.description: Browsing Spring Data REST repositories in your browser.

values.name: Spring HATEOAS
values.description: Eases the creation of RESTful APIs that follow the HATEOAS principle when working with Spring / Spring MVC.

guide.title: Building a Hypermedia-Driven RESTful Web Service

values.name: Spring Web Services
values.description: Facilitates contract-first SOAP development. Allows for the creation of flexible web services using one of the many ways to manipulate XML payloads.

values.name: Jersey
values.description: Framework for developing RESTful Web Services in Java that provides support for JAX-RS APIs.

values.name: Vaadin
values.description: The full-stack web app platform for Spring. Build views fully in Java with Flow, or in React using Hilla.

values.name: Netflix DGS
values.description: Build GraphQL applications with Netflix DGS and Spring for GraphQL.

values.name: htmx
values.description: Build modern user interfaces with the simplicity and power of hypertext.

values.name: Thymeleaf
values.description: A modern server-side Java template engine for both web and standalone environments. Allows HTML to be correctly displayed in browsers and as static prototypes.

values.name: Apache Freemarker
values.description: Java library to generate text output (HTML web pages, e-mails, configuration files, source code, etc.) based on templates and changing data.

values.name: Mustache
values.description: Logic-less templates for both web and standalone environments. There are no if statements, else clauses, or for loops. Instead there are only tags.

values.name: Groovy Templates
values.description: Groovy templating engine.

values.name: JTE
values.description: Secure and lightweight template engine for Java and Kotlin.

values.name: Spring Security
values.description: Highly customizable authentication and access-control framework for Spring applications.

values.name: OAuth2 Client
values.description: Spring Boot integration for Spring Security's OAuth2/OpenID Connect client features.

values.name: OAuth2 Authorization Server
values.description: Spring Boot integration for Spring Authorization Server.

values.name: OAuth2 Resource Server
values.description: Spring Boot integration for Spring Security's OAuth2 resource server features.

values.name: Spring LDAP
values.description: Makes it easier to build Spring based applications that use the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol.

values.name: Okta
values.description: Okta specific configuration for Spring Security/Spring Boot OAuth2 features. Enable your Spring Boot application to work with Okta via OAuth 2.0/OIDC.

guide.title: Okta Spring Security Resource Server Example

values.name: JDBC API
values.description: Database Connectivity API that defines how a client may connect and query a database.

guide.title: Accessing Relational Data using JDBC with Spring

values.name: Spring Data JPA
values.description: Persist data in SQL stores with Java Persistence API using Spring Data and Hibernate.

values.name: Spring Data JDBC
values.description: Persist data in SQL stores with plain JDBC using Spring Data.

values.name: Spring Data R2DBC
values.description: Provides Reactive Relational Database Connectivity to persist data in SQL stores using Spring Data in reactive applications.

values.name: MyBatis Framework
values.description: Persistence framework with support for custom SQL, stored procedures and advanced mappings. MyBatis couples objects with stored procedures or SQL statements using a XML descriptor or annotations.

values.name: Liquibase Migration
values.description: Liquibase database migration and source control library.

values.name: Flyway Migration
values.description: Version control for your database so you can migrate from any version (incl. an empty database) to the latest version of the schema.

values.name: JOOQ Access Layer
values.description: Generate Java code from your database and build type safe SQL queries through a fluent API.

values.name: IBM DB2 Driver
values.description: A JDBC driver that provides access to IBM DB2.

values.name: Apache Derby Database
values.description: An open source relational database implemented entirely in Java.

values.name: H2 Database
values.description: Provides a fast in-memory database that supports JDBC API and R2DBC access, with a small (2mb) footprint. Supports embedded and server modes as well as a browser based console application.

values.name: HyperSQL Database
values.description: Lightweight 100% Java SQL Database Engine.

values.name: MariaDB Driver
values.description: MariaDB JDBC and R2DBC driver.

values.name: MS SQL Server Driver
values.description: A JDBC and R2DBC driver that provides access to Microsoft SQL Server and Azure SQL Database from any Java application.

values.name: MySQL Driver
values.description: MySQL JDBC driver.

values.name: Oracle Driver
values.description: A JDBC driver that provides access to Oracle.

values.name: PostgreSQL Driver
values.description: A JDBC and R2DBC driver that allows Java programs to connect to a PostgreSQL database using standard, database independent Java code.

values.name: Spring Data Redis (Access+Driver)
values.description: Advanced and thread-safe Java Redis client for synchronous, asynchronous, and reactive usage. Supports Cluster, Sentinel, Pipelining, Auto-Reconnect, Codecs and much more.

values.name: Spring Data Reactive Redis
values.description: Access Redis key-value data stores in a reactive fashion with Spring Data Redis.

values.name: Spring Data MongoDB
values.description: Store data in flexible, JSON-like documents, meaning fields can vary from document to document and data structure can be changed over time.

values.name: Spring Data Reactive MongoDB
values.description: Provides asynchronous stream processing with non-blocking back pressure for MongoDB.

values.name: Spring Data Elasticsearch (Access+Driver)
values.description: A distributed, RESTful search and analytics engine with Spring Data Elasticsearch.

values.name: Spring Data for Apache Cassandra
values.description: A free and open-source, distributed, NoSQL database management system that offers high-scalability and high-performance.

values.name: Spring Data Reactive for Apache Cassandra
values.description: Access Cassandra NoSQL Database in a reactive fashion.

values.name: Spring Data Couchbase
values.description: NoSQL document-oriented database that offers in memory-first architecture, geo-distributed deployments, and workload isolation.

values.name: Spring Data Reactive Couchbase
values.description: Access Couchbase NoSQL database in a reactive fashion with Spring Data Couchbase.

values.name: Spring Data Neo4j
values.description: An open source NoSQL database that stores data structured as graphs consisting of nodes, connected by relationships.

values.name: Spring Integration
values.description: Adds support for Enterprise Integration Patterns. Enables lightweight messaging and supports integration with external systems via declarative adapters.

values.name: Spring for RabbitMQ
values.description: Gives your applications a common platform to send and receive messages, and your messages a safe place to live until received.

values.name: Spring for RabbitMQ Streams
values.description: Building stream processing applications with RabbitMQ.

values.name: Spring for Apache Kafka
values.description: Publish, subscribe, store, and process streams of records.

values.name: Spring for Apache Kafka Streams
values.description: Building stream processing applications with Apache Kafka Streams.

guide.title: Samples for using Apache Kafka Streams with Spring Cloud stream

reference.title: Apache Kafka Streams Binding Capabilities of Spring Cloud Stream

values.name: Spring for Apache ActiveMQ 5
values.description: Spring JMS support with Apache ActiveMQ 'Classic'.

guide.title: Java Message Service API via Apache ActiveMQ Classic.

values.name: Spring for Apache ActiveMQ Artemis
values.description: Spring JMS support with Apache ActiveMQ Artemis.

values.name: Spring for Apache Pulsar
values.description: Build messaging applications with Apache Pulsar

values.name: Spring for Apache Pulsar (Reactive)
values.description: Build reactive messaging applications with Apache Pulsar

values.name: WebSocket
values.description: Build Servlet-based WebSocket applications with SockJS and STOMP.

guide.title: Using WebSocket to build an interactive web application

values.name: RSocket
values.description: RSocket.io applications with Spring Messaging and Netty.

values.name: Apache Camel
values.description: Apache Camel is an open source integration framework that empowers you to quickly and easily integrate various systems consuming or producing data.

guide.title: Using Apache Camel with Spring Boot

values.name: Solace PubSub+
values.description: Connect to a Solace PubSub+ Advanced Event Broker to publish, subscribe, request/reply and store/replay messages

reference.title: Getting started with Solace and Spring

values.name: Spring Batch
values.description: Batch applications with transactions, retry/skip and chunk based processing.

values.name: Validation
values.description: Bean Validation with Hibernate validator.

values.name: Java Mail Sender
values.description: Send email using Java Mail and Spring Framework's JavaMailSender.

values.name: Quartz Scheduler
values.description: Schedule jobs using Quartz.

values.name: Spring Cache Abstraction
values.description: Provides cache-related operations, such as the ability to update the content of the cache, but does not provide the actual data store.

values.name: Spring Shell
values.description: Build command line applications with spring.

values.name: Spring gRPC [Experimental]
values.description: Experimental support for gRPC, a high performance, open source universal RPC framework.

sample.title: Various sample apps using Spring gRPC

values.name: Spring Boot Actuator
values.description: Supports built in (or custom) endpoints that let you monitor and manage your application - such as application health, metrics, sessions, etc.

guide.title: Building a RESTful Web Service with Spring Boot Actuator

values.name: CycloneDX SBOM support
values.description: Creates a Software Bill of Materials in CycloneDX format.

values.name: codecentric's Spring Boot Admin (Client)
values.description: Required for your application to register with a Codecentric's Spring Boot Admin Server instance.

values.name: codecentric's Spring Boot Admin (Server)
values.description: A community project to manage and monitor your Spring Boot applications. Provides a UI on top of the Spring Boot Actuator endpoints.

values.name: Sentry
values.description: Application performance monitoring and error tracking that help software teams see clearer, solve quicker, and learn continuously.

values.name: Datadog
values.description: Publish Micrometer metrics to Datadog, a dimensional time-series SaaS with built-in dashboarding and alerting.

values.name: Dynatrace
values.description: Publish Micrometer metrics to Dynatrace, a platform featuring observability, AIOps, application security and analytics.

values.name: Influx
values.description: Publish Micrometer metrics to InfluxDB, a dimensional time-series server that support real-time stream processing of data.

values.name: Graphite
values.description: Publish Micrometer metrics to Graphite, a hierarchical metrics system backed by a fixed-size database.

values.name: New Relic
values.description: Publish Micrometer metrics to New Relic, a SaaS offering with a full UI and a query language called NRQL.

values.name: OTLP for metrics
values.description: Publish Micrometer metrics to an OpenTelemetry Protocol (OTLP) capable backend.

values.name: Prometheus
values.description: Expose Micrometer metrics in Prometheus format, an in-memory dimensional time series database with a simple built-in UI, a custom query language, and math operations.

values.name: Distributed Tracing
values.description: Enable span and trace IDs in logs.

values.name: Wavefront
values.description: Publish metrics and optionally distributed traces to Tanzu Observability by Wavefront, a SaaS-based metrics monitoring and analytics platform that lets you visualize, query, and alert over data from across your entire stack.

values.name: Zipkin
values.description: Enable and expose span and trace IDs to Zipkin.

values.name: Spring REST Docs
values.description: Document RESTful services by combining hand-written with Asciidoctor and auto-generated snippets produced with Spring MVC Test.

values.name: Testcontainers
values.description: Provide lightweight, throwaway instances of common databases, Selenium web browsers, or anything else that can run in a Docker container.

values.name: Contract Verifier
values.description: Moves TDD to the level of software architecture by enabling Consumer Driven Contract (CDC) development.

values.name: Contract Stub Runner
values.description: Stub Runner for HTTP/Messaging based communication. Allows creating WireMock stubs from RestDocs tests.

values.name: Embedded LDAP Server
values.description: Provides a platform neutral way for running a LDAP server in unit tests.

values.name: Cloud Bootstrap
values.description: Non-specific Spring Cloud features, unrelated to external libraries or integrations (e.g. Bootstrap context and @RefreshScope).

values.name: Function
values.description: Promotes the implementation of business logic via functions and supports a uniform programming model across serverless providers, as well as the ability to run standalone (locally or in a PaaS).

sample.title: Various sample apps using Spring Cloud Function

values.name: Task
values.description: Allows a user to develop and run short lived microservices using Spring Cloud. Run them locally, in the cloud, and on Spring Cloud Data Flow.

values.name: Config Client
values.description: Client that connects to a Spring Cloud Config Server to fetch the application's configuration.

values.name: Config Server
values.description: Central management for configuration via Git, SVN, or HashiCorp Vault.

values.name: Vault Configuration
values.description: Provides client-side support for externalized configuration in a distributed system. Using HashiCorp's Vault you have a central place to manage external secret properties for applications across all environments.

values.name: Apache Zookeeper Configuration
values.description: Enable and configure common patterns inside your application and build large distributed systems with Apache Zookeeper based components. The provided patterns include Service Discovery and Configuration.

values.name: Consul Configuration
values.description: Enable and configure the common patterns inside your application and build large distributed systems with Hashicorp’s Consul. The patterns provided include Service Discovery, Distributed Configuration and Control Bus.

values.name: Eureka Discovery Client
values.description: A REST based service for locating services for the purpose of load balancing and failover of middle-tier servers.

guide.title: Service Registration and Discovery with Eureka and Spring Cloud

values.name: Eureka Server
values.description: spring-cloud-netflix Eureka Server.

guide.title: Service Registration and Discovery with Eureka and Spring Cloud

values.name: Apache Zookeeper Discovery
values.description: Service discovery with Apache Zookeeper.

values.name: Consul Discovery
values.description: Service discovery with Hashicorp Consul.

values.name: Gateway
values.description: Provides a simple, yet effective way to route to APIs in Servlet-based applications. Provides cross-cutting concerns to those APIs such as security, monitoring/metrics, and resiliency.

values.name: Reactive Gateway
values.description: Provides a simple, yet effective way to route to APIs in reactive applications. Provides cross-cutting concerns to those APIs such as security, monitoring/metrics, and resiliency.

values.name: OpenFeign
values.description: Declarative REST Client. OpenFeign creates a dynamic implementation of an interface decorated with JAX-RS or Spring MVC annotations.

sample.title: Declarative REST calls with Spring Cloud OpenFeign sample

values.name: Cloud LoadBalancer
values.description: Client-side load-balancing with Spring Cloud LoadBalancer.

guide.title: Client-side load-balancing with Spring Cloud LoadBalancer

values.name: Resilience4J
values.description: Spring Cloud Circuit breaker with Resilience4j as the underlying implementation.

values.name: Cloud Bus
values.description: Links nodes of a distributed system with a lightweight message broker which can used to broadcast state changes or other management instructions (requires a binder, e.g. Apache Kafka or RabbitMQ).

values.name: Cloud Stream
values.description: Framework for building highly scalable event-driven microservices connected with shared messaging systems (requires a binder, e.g. Apache Kafka, Apache Pulsar, RabbitMQ, or Solace PubSub+).

values.name: Config Client (TAS)
values.description: Config client on VMware Tanzu Application Service.

values.name: Service Registry (TAS)
values.description: Eureka service discovery client on VMware Tanzu Application Service.

values.name: Azure Support
values.description: Auto-configuration for Azure Services (Service Bus, Storage, Active Directory, Key Vault, and more).

guide.title: Deploying a Spring Boot app to Azure

values.name: Azure Active Directory
values.description: Spring Security integration with Azure Active Directory for authentication.

guide.title: Securing a Java Web App with the Spring Boot Starter for Azure Active Directory

values.name: Azure Cosmos DB
values.description: Fully managed NoSQL database service for modern app development, including Spring Data support.

guide.title: How to use Spring Boot Starter with Azure Cosmos DB SQL API

values.name: Azure Key Vault
values.description: All key vault features are supported, e.g. manage application secrets and certificates.

guide.title: Read Secrets from Azure Key Vault in a Spring Boot Application
Securing Spring Boot Applications with Azure Key Vault Certificates

values.name: Azure Storage
values.description: All Storage features are supported, e.g. blob, fileshare and queue.

guide.title: How to use the Spring Boot starter for Azure Storage

values.name: Google Cloud Support
values.description: Contains auto-configuration support for every Google Cloud integration. Most of the auto-configuration code is only enabled if other dependencies are added to the classpath.

values.name: Google Cloud Messaging
values.description: Adds the Google Cloud Support entry and all the required dependencies so that the Google Cloud Pub/Sub integration work out of the box.

values.name: Google Cloud Storage
values.description: Adds the Google Cloud Support entry and all the required dependencies so that the Google Cloud Storage integration work out of the box.

values.name: Anthropic Claude
values.description: Spring AI support for Anthropic Claude AI models.

values.name: Azure OpenAI
values.description: Spring AI support for Azure’s OpenAI offering, powered by ChatGPT. It extends beyond traditional OpenAI capabilities, delivering AI-driven text generation with enhanced functionality.

values.name: Azure AI Search
values.description: Spring AI vector database support for Azure AI Search. It is an AI-powered information retrieval platform and part of Microsoft’s larger AI platform. Among other features, it allows users to query information using vector-based storage and retrieval.

values.name: Amazon Bedrock
values.description: Spring AI support for Amazon Bedrock. It is a managed service that provides foundation models from various AI providers, available through a unified API.

values.name: Amazon Bedrock Converse
values.description: Spring AI support for Amazon Bedrock Converse. It provides a unified interface for conversational AI models with enhanced capabilities including function/tool calling, multimodal inputs, and streaming responses.

values.name: Apache Cassandra Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI vector database support for Apache Cassandra.

values.name: Chroma Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI vector database support for Chroma. It is an open-source embedding database and gives you the tools to store document embeddings, content, and metadata. It also allows to search through those embeddings, including metadata filtering.

values.name: Elasticsearch Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI vector database support for Elasticsearch.

values.name: Milvus Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI vector database support for Milvus. It is an open-source vector database that has garnered significant attention in the fields of data science and machine learning. One of its standout features lies in its robust support for vector indexing and querying.

values.name: Mistral AI
values.description: Spring AI support for Mistral AI, the open and portable generative AI for devs and businesses.

values.name: MongoDB Atlas Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI vector database support for MongoDB Atlas. Is is a fully managed cloud database service that provides an easy way to deploy, operate, and scale a MongoDB database in the cloud.

values.name: Neo4j Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI vector database support for Neo4j's Vector Search. It allows users to query vector embeddings from large datasets.

values.name: Ollama
values.description: Spring AI support for Ollama. It allows you to run various Large Language Models (LLMs) locally and generate text from them.

values.name: OpenAI
values.description: Spring AI support for ChatGPT, the AI language model and DALL-E, the Image generation model from OpenAI.

values.name: Oracle Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI vector database support for Oracle. Enables storing, indexing and searching vector embeddings in Oracle Database 23ai.

values.name: PGvector Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI vector database support for PGvector. It is an open-source extension for PostgreSQL that enables storing and searching over machine learning-generated embeddings.

values.name: Pinecone Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI vector database support for Pinecone. It is a popular cloud-based vector database and allows you to store and search vectors efficiently.

values.name: PostgresML
values.description: Spring AI support for the PostgresML text embeddings models.

values.name: Redis Search and Query Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI vector database support for Redis Search and Query. It extends the core features of Redis OSS and allows you to use Redis as a vector database.

values.name: MariaDB Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI support for MariaDB. MariaDB Vector Store support is part of MariaDB 11.7. It provides efficient vector similarity search capabilities using vector indexes, supporting both cosine similarity and Euclidean distance metrics.

values.name: Oracle Coherence Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI support for Oracle Coherence. Oracle Coherence Vector Store is a key-value store with optional persistence, offering fault-tolerant automatic sharding, polyglot and REST interfaces, querying, transactions, eventing, and in-place processing, as well as change data capture, multi-site federation, messaging, and integrations with popular frameworks.

values.name: Azure Cosmos DB Vector Store
values.description: Spring AI support for Azure Cosmos DB. Azure Cosmos DB is Microsoft’s globally distributed cloud-native database service designed for mission-critical applications.

values.name: Stability AI
values.description: Spring AI support for Stability AI's text to image generation model.

values.name: Transformers (ONNX) Embeddings
values.description: Spring AI support for pre-trained transformer models, serialized into the Open Neural Network Exchange (ONNX) format.

values.name: Vertex AI Gemini
values.description: Spring AI support for Google Vertex Gemini chat. Doesn't support embeddings.

values.name: Vertex AI Embeddings
values.description: Spring AI support for Google Vertex text and multimodal embedding models.

values.name: Qdrant Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI vector database support for Qdrant. It is an open-source, high-performance vector search engine/database.

values.name: Typesense Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI vector database support for Typesense.

values.name: Weaviate Vector Database
values.description: Spring AI vector database support for Weaviate, an open-source vector database. It allows you to store data objects and vector embeddings from your favorite ML-models and scale seamlessly into billions of data objects.

values.name: Markdown Document Reader
values.description: Spring AI Markdown document reader. It allows to load Markdown documents, converting them into a list of Spring AI Document objects.

values.name: Tika Document Reader
values.description: Spring AI Tika document reader. It uses Apache Tika to extract text from a variety of document formats, such as PDF, DOC/DOCX, PPT/PPTX, and HTML. The documents are converted into a list of Spring AI Document objects.

values.name: PDF Document Reader
values.description: Spring AI PDF document reader. It uses Apache PdfBox to extract text from PDF documents and converting them into a list of Spring AI Document objects.

values.name: Timefold Solver
values.description: AI solver to optimize operations and scheduling.

sample.title: Timetabling sample. Assign lessons to timeslots and rooms to produce a better schedule for teachers and students

values.name: Gradle - Groovy
values.description: Generate a Gradle based project archive using the Groovy DSL.

values.name: Gradle - Kotlin
values.description: Generate a Gradle based project archive using the Kotlin DSL.

values.name: Gradle Config
values.description: Generate a Gradle build file.

values.name: Maven
values.description: Generate a Maven based project archive.

values.name: Maven POM
values.description: Generate a Maven pom.xml.
